qas.question: When was Easter Sunday celebrated after the equinox?
What did churches do to settle the date if there was a difference?
By what century had almost all churches begun celebrating Easter according to the Alexandrian Easter?
On what border of the Byzantine Empire were the last holdouts for celebrating according the  Alexandrian Easter?
What date placement drifted increasingly off the true date on the calendar?
What was celebrated on the fifteenth day after the equinox?
In what century did all the churches adopt the Alexandrian Easter?
Who noticed the equinox drift in the seventh century?
What did the Alexandrian Easter place on 25 March?

context: <b5_0>Easter<b5_0/> was the Sunday after the <a0_0>15th day<a0_0/> of this moon, whose 14th day was allowed to precede the equinox. Where the two systems produced different dates there was generally a <a1_0>compromise<a1_0/> so that both churches were able to celebrate on the same day. By <b6_0>the <a2_0>10th century<b6_0/><a2_0/> all churches (except some on the <a3_0>eastern border<a3_0/> of the Byzantine Empire) had adopted the Alexandrian Easter, which still placed <b8_0>the <a4_0>vernal equinox<b8_0/><a4_0/> on 21 March, although <b7_0>Bede<b7_0/> had already noted its drift in 725—it had drifted even further by the 16th century.
